title: Improve syntax diagnostics or suggestions with `enum` vs `struct`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
I changed an enum to a struct but forgot to change the `enum` keyword to a `struct` keyword, it took me a while to realize what the problem was because the error is unclear.

### `enum` used where code looks like a struct

```rust
pub enum NotEnum {
    field: u8   
}
```

The error is

```
error: expected one of `(`, `,`, `=`, `{`, or `}`, found `:`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:10
  |
2 |     field: u8,    
  |          ^ expected one of `(`, `,`, `=`, `{`, or `}`

error: expected item, found `:`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:10
  |
2 |     field: u8,    
  |          ^ expected item
```

A suggestion saying ```help: change `enum` to `struct` ``` would be useful.

### `struct` used where code looks like an enum

```rust
pub struct NotStruct {
    Variant
}
```

```
error: expected `:`, found `}`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:1
  |
2 |     Variant
  |            - expected `:`
3 | }
  | ^ unexpected token
```

A suggestion saying ```help: change `struct` to `enum` ``` would be useful.
